docs.lead_paragraph: Four years after the murder of an abortion provider in Wichita, a new women’s medical clinic has opened.

headline.seo: Courage on Abortion in Wichita, Kansas

docs.abstract: Editorial welcomes opening of new women's clinic in Kansas in same building that once housed clinic run by Dr George Tiller, who was murdered by anti-abortion extremist; contends clinic is tribute to perseverance and courage of those involved in the project, especially Julie Burkhart, former colleague of Tiller who directs Trust Women Foundation, which runs clinic.
docs.snippet: Four years after the murder of an abortion provider in Wichita, a new women’s medical clinic has opened.

docs.lead_paragraph: Experts offer strategies for controlling and managing conflict, which can make families happier.
docs.abstract: Bruce Feiler This Life column shares tips from experts on how to control and manage family conflict.
docs.snippet: Experts offer strategies for controlling and managing conflict, which can make families happier.

docs.lead_paragraph: The State House approved a measure that would outlaw abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, based on the disputed premise that a fetus can feel pain at that point.

headline.main: North Dakota: House Passes More Abortion Limits
headline.print_headline: North Dakota: House Passes More Abortion Limits

docs.abstract: North Dakota State House approves measure that would outlaw abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, based on disputed premise that a fetus can feel pain at that point.
docs.snippet: The State House approved a measure that would outlaw abortions after 20 weeks of pregnancy, based on the disputed premise that a fetus can feel pain at that point.

docs.lead_paragraph: Jenna Bush Hager, daughter and granddaughter of former presidents and about to become a mother, says she is happy being a member of the press on the “Today” show.

headline.seo: Jenna Bush Hager Is Happy Reporting for ‘Today’
headline.main: Once the Story, Now She’s Telling It
headline.print_headline: Once the Story, Now She’s Telling It

docs.abstract: Jenna Bush Hager, daughter and granddaughter of former presidents who is about to become a mother, has officially become member of the press herself; in addition to publishing young adult novel Ana's Story: A Journey of Hope, she has become a regular correspondent on NBC's Today show and is editor at large at Southern Living magazine.
docs.snippet: Jenna Bush Hager, daughter and granddaughter of former presidents and about to become a mother, says she is happy being a member of the press on the “Today” show.

docs.lead_paragraph:
Peter Workman, the founder of Workman Publishing , whose knack for landing best-selling trade books like “What to Expect When You’re Expecting,” and “The Silver Palate Cookbook” built his company into one of the few remaining independent book publishers in the country, died on Sunday at his home in Manhattan. He was 74.
 
The cause was cancer, a company spokesman said.
docs.abstract: Peter Workman, founder of Workman Publishing who built company into one of the few remaining independent book publishers in the country, dies at age 74. Photo (M)

docs.lead_paragraph: A midwife said her comment to a dying patient who had pleaded for a potentially lifesaving abortion — that Ireland was a Catholic country — had not been intended to be hurtful.

headline.seo: Religious Remark Confirmed in Irish Abortion Case
headline.main: Religious Remark Confirmed in Irish Abortion Case
headline.print_headline: Religious Remark Confirmed in Irish Abortion Case

docs.snippet: A midwife said her comment to a dying patient who had pleaded for a potentially lifesaving abortion — that Ireland was a Catholic country — had not been intended to be hurtful.

docs.lead_paragraph: Dr. Edwards, a physiologist working out of the University of Cambridge in England, changed the prospects for infertile couples and forged a brand-new industry.

headline.seo: Robert G. Edwards, Nobel Winner for In Vitro Fertilization, Dies at 87
headline.main: Robert G. Edwards Dies at 87; Changed Rules of Conception With First ‘Test Tube Baby’
headline.print_headline: Changing Rules of Conception With the First ‘Test Tube Baby’

docs.abstract: Robert G Edwards, Nobel Prize-winning physiologist who opened new era in medicine when he joined in developing in vitro fertilization, dies at age 87; helped change prospects for infertile couples and forged brand-new industry.
docs.snippet: Dr. Edwards, a physiologist working out of the University of Cambridge in England, changed the prospects for infertile couples and forged a brand-new industry.

headline.main: When East Meets West, Parents and Grandparents Collide

docs.abstract: When we took our newborn child and deposited him in a crib (and out of our bed, thank you very much) a mere three months into his little life, our Indian family thought us heartless and cruel.
docs.snippet: When we took our newborn child and deposited him in a crib (and out of our bed, thank you very much) a mere three months into his little life, our Indian family thought us heartless and cruel.

docs.lead_paragraph: A treatment pulled off the market 30 years ago has won Food and Drug Administration approval again as the only drug designated to treat morning sickness.
docs.abstract: Treatment pulled off market 30 years ago wins Food and Drug Administration approval again as only drug designated to treat morning sickness; drug once called Bendectin is set to return to American pharmacies under name Diclegis.
docs.snippet: A treatment pulled off the market 30 years ago has won Food and Drug Administration approval again as the only drug designated to treat morning sickness.

docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Workman was known for working closely with authors and editors, and it was his knack for marketing that helped propel books like “What to Expect When You’re Expecting.”

headline.main: Peter Workman, Book Publisher With an Eye for Hits, Dies at 74

docs.abstract: Peter Workman, founder of Workman Publishing who built company into one of the few remaining independent book publishers in the country, dies at age 74.
docs.snippet: Mr. Workman was known for working closely with authors and editors, and it was his knack for marketing that helped propel books like “What to Expect When You’re Expecting.”
